moves.1. Nf3: The game went smoothly, no big mistakes where made from both parts.
moves.1... d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. e3 g6 5:
It all starts here! 
The black queen doesn't have many places to go: 18. ... Qc2 was probably the only move that would prevent what came next. And even that isn't very good because of 19. Qa2! which is very dangerous: 19. ... Qxe2, 20. Nxe7  Kh8, 21. Bxg7 Kxg7 and the black Queen falls...
moves.18... Qb7 19. Bxg7 Kxg7 20. Qb2+ Kg8: This was a blunder from the Black player, which leads to my trap!...
moves.21. Ba6:
This was the master move :-).  I think this was my best move ever!
I have seen this when thinking on move 18. Nd5, but I never expected him to fall in my trap. It's a nice decoy one could lead into...
And to avoid mate, the Queen must be sacrificed. (after 21. ... Qd7; 22. Nf6 , and white stays with a very good advantage; another alternative after 21. ...Qd7, is 22. Bxc8 Rxc8, 23. Rc1 !, after which there isn't much thinking to do...; any other move from Black its terrible)
